class db_models.orms.BillingORM(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: BaseORM

ORM class for the âbillingâ table, representing a bill associated with a parking session.

id

The primary key of the bill.

Type:

int

parking_history_id

The foreign key referencing the parking history.

Type:

int

user_id

The foreign key referencing the user associated with the bill.

Type:

int

cost

The cost of the parking session.

Type:

Optional[float]

is_sent

Whether the bill has been sent to the user.

Type:

bool

is_paid

Whether the bill has been paid.

Type:

bool

Relationships:

history (ParkingHistoryORM): The parking history associated with the bill. user (UserORM): The user associated with the bill. message (ServiceMessageORM): A service message associated with the bill.

cost: Mapped[Optional[float]]
history: Mapped[ParkingHistoryORM]

async admin.routes.add_tariff(request: Request, new_rate: float = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Adds a new parking tariff to the database. Only administrators are allowed to perform this action.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The current request object.

  • new_rate (float) â The new tariff rate to be added.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • access_token (Optional[str], optional) â The access token stored in cookies.

Returns:

Renders the tariff added confirmation page, or the login page if access is not granted.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

Raises:

HTTPException â If the current user is not an admin.

async admin.routes.add_user(request: Request, username: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), email: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: str | None = None)[source]

Handle the âAdd Userâ form submission.

This route allows an admin to add a new user to the database. If the user is not authenticated, or not an admin, they are redirected to the login page. It ensures the username is unique and stores the userâs details with a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • username (str) â The new userâs username.

  • email (str) â The new userâs email.

  • password (str) â The new userâs password.

  • db (AsyncSession) â An asynchronous session for interacting with the database.

  • access_token (str | None) â A cookie containing the userâs access token (optional).

Returns:

Renders the âuser_added.htmlâ template after successful addition, or the âadd_user_form.htmlâ template with an error message if any checks fail.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

async admin.routes.add_user_form(request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: str | None = None)[source]

Display the âAdd Userâ form.

This route allows administrators to view the âAdd Userâ form. Non-authenticated users or non-admin users are redirected to the login page.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) â An asynchronous session for interacting with the database.

  • access_token (str | None) â A cookie containing the userâs access token (optional).

Returns:

TemplateResponse

async admin.routes.ban_user(request: Request, username: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bans a user by setting their âis_bannedâ flag to True in the database.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The FastAPI request object.

  • username (str) â The username of the user to ban.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session, retrieved via dependency injection.

  • access_token (Optional[str]) â The access token stored in the browserâs cookie.

Returns:

Renders a success page if the user is banned successfully,

or an appropriate error page if there are issues (e.g., user not found).

Return type:

HTMLResponse

Raises:

HTTPException â If the user is not authorized or user to ban is not found.

async admin.routes.delete_user(request: Request, username: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: str | None = None)[source]

Delete a user by username.

This route allows an admin to delete a user from the database. If the user is not authenticated or not an admin, they are redirected to the login page. If the user does not exist, an error is shown.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • username (str) â The username of the user to be deleted.

  • db (AsyncSession) â An asynchronous session for interacting with the database.

  • access_token (str | None) â A cookie containing the userâs access token (optional).

Returns:

Renders the âuser_deleted.htmlâ template after successful deletion, or the âdelete_user_form.htmlâ template with an error message if any checks fail.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

async admin.routes.get_admin_page(request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: str | None = None)[source]

Get the admin page.

This endpoint serves the admin page if the user is authenticated and has admin rights. If the user is not authenticated or doesnât have admin rights, an appropriate message or login page will be returned.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The database session dependency.

  • access_token (Annotated[str | None, Cookie()]) â The access token from cookies, if available.

Returns:

  • Admin page template if the user is an admin.

  • Login form template if the user is not authenticated.

  • Access denied template if the user is not an admin.

Return type:

HTMLResponse

Raises:

None â

async admin.routes.get_blacklist_management(request: Request, access_token: str | None = None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session))[source]

Renders the blacklist management page for an admin user.

If no access token is provided, or if the current user is not an admin, the login form is rendered. Otherwise, the blacklist management page is returned.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The incoming HTTP request object.

  • access_token (str | None, optional) â The access token from the userâs cookie. Defaults to None.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The database session for querying user data. Defaults to an asynchronous session from get_session.

Returns:

The HTML response to render the appropriate template, either the login form or the blacklist management page.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

Raises:

None â

  • access_token (str | None, optional) â The access token extracted from cookies to identify the user.

TemplateResponse

async admin.routes.get_tariff_management(request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: str | None = None)[source]

Handles the GET request for the tariff management page.

This route allows an admin user to access the tariff management page. If the user is not logged in or doesnât have admin privileges, they will be redirected to the login page.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The request object containing details of the current request.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session used to fetch the user data.

  • access_token (str, optional) â The access token stored in cookies to identify the logged-in user.

Returns:

  • If the user is not logged in, returns the login form page.

  • If the user is logged in but not an admin, returns the login form page with an error message.

  • If the user is an admin, returns the tariff management page.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

Raises:

None. â

async admin.routes.logout(request: Request, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Logs out the current user by deleting their access and refresh tokens from cookies. Only administrators can perform this action.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The current request object.

  • response (Response) â The response object to manipulate cookies.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session dependency.

  • access_token (Optional[str], optional) â The access token stored in cookies.

Returns:

Renders the logout success page or the login page if access is not granted.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

Raises:

HTTPException â If the current user is not an admin.

async admin.routes.unban_user(request: Request, username: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_session), access_token: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Unbans a user by setting their âis_bannedâ flag to False in the database.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The FastAPI request object.

  • username (str) â The username of the user to unban.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session, retrieved via dependency injection.

  • access_token (Optional[str]) â The access token stored in the browserâs cookie.

Returns:

or an appropriate error page if there are issues (e.g., user not found).

Return type:

HTMLResponse

Raises:

HTTPException â If the user is not authorized or user to unban is not found.

async cameras.utils.get_credit_limit_for_date(date: date, db: AsyncSession) → float[source]

Fetches the credit limit for a specific date.

This function retrieves the credit limit from the CreditLimitsORM table that was set on or before the specified date. It orders the limits by set_date in descending order to get the latest limit up to that date.

Parameters:

  • date (datetime.date) â The date to find the credit limit for.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The credit limit for the specified date.

Return type:

float

async cameras.utils.get_tariff_for_date(date: date, db: AsyncSession) → float[source]

Fetches the tariff for a specific date.

This function retrieves the tariff from the TariffORM table that was set on or before the specified date. It orders the tariffs by set_date in descending order to get the latest tariff up to that date.

Parameters:

  • date (datetime.date) â The date to find the tariff for.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The tariff value for the specified date.

Return type:

float

async cameras.utils.set_unleaved_ban(car: CarORM, db: AsyncSession) → int[source]

Sets a ban for a car that has not left the parking area.

This function marks the end time of a parking session for the specified car if no end time is currently set (i.e., the car has not left). It calculates the parking cost based on the tariff applicable at the start time and marks the bill as sent and the user as banned. The userâs account is updated accordingly.

Parameters:

  • car (CarORM) â The car object representing the vehicle to be banned.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The bill ID of the updated parking session.

Return type:

int

async cameras.utils.set_unparked_ban(car: CarORM, db: AsyncSession) → int[source]

async frontend.routes.about(request: Request, access_token: str | None = None)[source]

Render the about page.

This route handles rendering the about page. If an access token is present in the cookies, it extracts the current user and passes the user information to the template. Otherwise, the user will be None.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • access_token (str | None, optional) â The access token stored in cookies. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The rendered âabout.htmlâ template with the request and user data.

Return type:

TemplateResponse

async frontend.routes.get_parking_lots(request: Request, db: AsyncSession) → Any[source]

Fetches and returns parking lot information, including occupied, free, and total spaces.

The function retrieves all parking lots from the database, processes the data, and calculates the number of free and occupied parking spaces. It returns an HTML response with the template âlots.htmlâ and the parking information.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • db (Annotated[AsyncSession, Depends]) â The database session to execute the queries.

Returns:

An HTML response with the parking lot information (total spaces, free spaces, occupied spaces) and a list of parking lots.

async user.routes.get_car_bills(request: Request, db: AsyncSession, car_plate: str, access_token: Optional[str] = None) → Any[source]

Retrieves and displays the billing information for a car associated with the currently authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The incoming request object.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The database session dependency.

  • car_plate (str) â The license plate of the car.

  • access_token (Optional[str], optional) â The JWT access token, retrieved from cookies. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The response template rendering the car bills or an error message if the car is not registered under the userâs account.

Return type:

Any

Raises:

HTTPException â If the car does not belong to the authenticated user.

Notes

  • If the user is not logged in, the login form will be displayed.

  • The userâs bills are retrieved from the database and displayed along with relevant parking history.

async user.routes.get_paybill(request: Request, bill_id: int, db: AsyncSession, access_token: Optional[str] = None) → Any[source]

Retrieve the billing details for a specific bill and render the payment page.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • bill_id (int) â The ID of the bill to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session.

  • access_token (Optional[str]) â The access token stored in the userâs cookies, used for authentication. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A template response displaying the bill payment form if the user is authenticated, or the login form if not.

Return type:

Any

Raises:

None â This function does not raise any exceptions directly.

Example

If the user is authenticated and the bill is found, a form with bill details is rendered for payment. If the user is not authenticated, a login form is presented.

async user.routes.post_paybill(request: Request, bill_id: int, db: AsyncSession, access_token: Optional[str] = None) → Any[source]

Process the payment of a specific bill and update the bill status.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) â The HTTP request object.

  • bill_id (int) â The ID of the bill to pay.

  • db (AsyncSession) â The asynchronous database session.

  • access_token (Optional[str]) â The access token stored in the userâs cookies, used for authentication. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A template response displaying the user dashboard after processing the payment, or the login form if the user is not authenticated.

Return type:

Any

Raises:

None â This function does not raise any exceptions directly.

Example

If the payment is successful, the bill is marked as paid, and any bans related to unpaid bills are removed. If the user is not authenticated, a login form is presented.
